champ.champInfo:
The general management of the organization and conduct of competitions is carried out by the department of non-Olympic sports, of scientific and medical support of the department of sports of higher achievements of the Ministry of Youth and Sports of Ukraine (hereinafter - the Ministry of Youth Sports) together with the NGO "National Kyokushinkai Karate Federation of Ukraine" (hereinafter - the Federation). The direct holding of competitions is entrusted to the Department of Physical Culture and Sports of the Lviv State Administration, Public organization sports club kyokushinkai karate "KANKU", the Main Board of Judges, approved by the Federation.

The chief judge of the competition is Shihan Mutin, a sports judge from Kyokushinkai karate of the international category Serhii Askhatovych, 5th dan (Lviv)

Judging of competitions is conducted in accordance with the standards and rules of the International Kyokushinkai Karate Organization (5 judges, flag signaling).

Venue of the competition: Emily Sport Arena, address: Vinnyki, str. Khmelnytskogo, 9b

The competition is held on November 26, 2023.The competition starts at 10:00

Regulations of the competition

November 26, 2023:

  • 07:30-08:30 - registration of competition participants in the kata section
  • 08:30-09:00 - drawing of competition participants in the "kata" section, meeting of the technical secretariat
  • 09:00-09:30 - meeting of competition judges
  • 09:30-10:00 - line-up of judges, team representatives, invited officials, line-up of participants for the entrance march
  • 10:00-13:00 - the beginning of qualifying competitions in the kata section
  • 13:00-14:00 - lunch of judges and team representatives
  • 14:00-16:00 - start of the semi-final and final part of the competition
  • 16:30-17:30 - end of competition, awarding of competition winners and prize-winners, closing of competition

Kata categories 2009-2019, 2011-2012, 2013-2014 born(Championship of Ukraine):

  • Complexity level of the "executioner" groups - 4
  • qualifying rounds: mandatory kata by drawing cards with their names - Taikyoku sono ichi, Taikyoku sono ni, Taikyoku sono san
  • semi-final, 3rd place match, final: personal choice kata with Pinan sono ichi, Pinan sono ni, Pinan sono san, Pinan sono yon, Pinan sono go
  • Meetings for 3rd and 4th place will be held if there are less than 8 athletes in the category
  • If the category has 8 or more participants, the fight for 3rd and 4th place will not be held, all semi-finalists who did not enter the final will receive 3rd place
  • Kata by personal choice in semi-finals, 3rd place matches and finals must be different

Kata categories born in 2007-2008(open All-Ukrainian tournament):

  • Complexity level of "kata" groups - 3
  • qualifying rounds: compulsory kata by drawing cards with their referee names - Pinan sono 2-5
  • Quarterfinals, Semifinals, 3rd Place Match, Final: Personal Choice Kata with Heksai-dai, Tsuki-no-kata, Yantsu
  • Personal choice kata in quarterfinals, semifinals, 3rd place match and final must be different
      • Team kata:
    • qualifying rounds: compulsory kata by drawing cards with their referee names - Pinan sono 2-5
    • Quarterfinals, Semifinals, 3rd Place Match, Final: Personal Choice Kata with Heksai-dai, Tsuki-no-kata, Yantsu
    • Kata by personal choice in semi-finals, 3rd place matches and finals must be different

Kata categories born in 2005-2006(open All-Ukrainian tournament):

  • Complexity level of the "executioner" groups - 2
  • qualifying rounds: mandatory kata by drawing cards with their referee names - Heksai-dai, Tsuki-no-kata, Yantsu
  • Quarterfinals, Semifinals 3rd place match, Final: personal choice kata from Heksai-dai, Tsuki-no-kata, Yantsu, Saiha or Heksai-sho
  • Personal choice kata in quarterfinals, semifinals, 3rd place match and final must be different
      • Team kata:
    • qualifying rounds: mandatory kata by drawing cards with their referee names - Heksai-dai, Tsuki-no-kata, Yantsu
    • semi-final match for 3rd place, final: personal choice kata with Garyu, Seipai, Seienchin, Kanku, Susi-ho
    • Kata by personal choice should be different

Categories of kata men/women (open Cup of Ukraine):

  • Complexity level of the "executioner" groups - 1
  • qualifying rounds: compulsory kata by drawing cards with their referee names - Heksai-dai, Yantsu, Tsuki-no-kata, Saiha, Heksai-sho
  • quarterfinals, semifinals 3rd place match, finals: kata of personal choice with Seipai, Garyu, Seienchin, Kanku, Susi-ho
  • Personal choice kata in the quarter-finals, semi-finals, 3rd place match and final must be different
      • Team kata:
    • qualifying rounds: compulsory kata by drawing cards with their referee names - Heksai-dai, Yantsu, Tsuki-no-kata, Saiha, Heksai-sho
    • Quarterfinals, Semifinals 3rd Place Match, Final: Personal Choice Kata from Heksai-dai, Tsuki-no-kata, Yantsu, Saiha or Heksai-sho
    • Kata by personal choice should be different

Categories of kata men-veterans (Championship of Ukraine):

Competitions (individual and team) are held in three age groups:

  • 35-40 years old
  • 41-45 years old
  • older than 46

  • Complexity level of the "executioner" groups - 1
  • qualifying rounds: compulsory kata by drawing cards with their referee names - Heksai-dai, Yantsu, Tsuki-no-kata, Saiha, Heksai-sho
  • quarterfinals, semifinals 3rd place match, finals: kata of personal choice with Seipai, Garyu, Seienchin, Kanku, Susi-ho
  • Personal choice kata in the quarter-finals, semi-finals, 3rd place match and final must be different
      • Team kata:
    • qualifying rounds: compulsory kata by drawing cards with their referee names - Heksai-dai, Yantsu, Tsuki-no-kata, Saiha, Heksai-sho
    • semi-final match for 3rd place, final: personal choice kata with Garyu, Seipai, Seienchin, Kanku, Susi-ho
    • Kata by personal choice should be different

Male and female participants compete in separate sections of the competition.
Participants compete in a sports uniform, according to the Rules of Kyokushinkai karate competitions in force in Ukraine.

FEE FOR PARTICIPATION IN THE CUP â€“ 900 UAH.

Winners and prize-winners are awarded with prizes and diplomas of the respective degrees.
